title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.7.12 | 27-12-2021
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Om Agyana Timiran Dasya Gyanan Janishalakaya
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers and mantras, invoking the blessings of the spiritual master and Lord Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Now I shall begin the transcendental narration of the Lord Sri Krishna and topics of the birth activities and deliverance of King Parikshit, the sage amongst kings, as well as topics of the renunciation of the worldly order by the sons of Pandu.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam (1.7.12) that will be discussed, focusing on Suta Goswami's intention to narrate Krishna Katha through the stories of King Parikshit and the Pandavas.

segments.key_quote: What is the connection between Pandavas renouncing this world and Krishna Katha and again what is the connection between Pariksit's birth activities and deliverance with Krishna Katha
segments.summary: The speaker questions the connection between the stories of the Pandavas and Parikshit and Krishna Katha, setting the stage for Srila Prabhupada's explanation.

segments.key_quote: Any historical fact old or new which has a connection with the activities of the Supreme Lord Krishna is to be understood as a transcendental narration of the Lord Shri Krishna
segments.summary: The speaker explains Srila Prabhupada's perspective that any historical fact connected to Krishna's activities is transcendental.

segments.key_quote: Without Krishna all the supplementary literatures like the Puranas and Mahabharata are simply stories or historical facts but with Krishna in connection with Krishna they become transcendental
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the transcendental nature of Srimad Bhagavatam, emphasizing that it is centered around the activities of Lord Krishna, making it the 'spotless Purana'.

segments.key_quote: Everything is centered around the activities of Krishna.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates that the activities of Krishna are central to the Srimad Bhagavatam, making all narrations spiritual when connected to Him.

segments.key_quote: There is a class of less intelligent devotees of Bhagavata Purana who desire to relish at once the activities of the Lord narrated in the 10th canto without first understanding the primary cantos.
segments.summary: The speaker addresses the common misconception of skipping to the 10th canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, emphasizing the importance of understanding the preceding cantos as they are all spiritually significant and centered around Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Beginning from the 1st canto is having spiritual description.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that Krishna appears in various forms and incarnations, and the activities of his pure devotees are also 100% spiritual.

segments.key_quote: Devotees are never without Krishna. And Krishna is never without devotees.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that all cantos of the Srimad Bhagavatam are equally important and that devotees are always connected to Krishna.

segments.key_quote: Talks about the devotees talks about krishna in relationship with the devotees or talks about the devotees in relationship with krishna everything is krishna katha
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by reiterating that any discussion about Krishna or his devotees is Krishna Katha, emphasizing their inseparable connection.
